This was one of my top favorite Airbnb stays! The location is perfect! The surroundings were beautiful with lots of roses and a neatly manicured property. The instructions on where to park were clearly marked. There was a fun hanging swing for two by the front door of the suite as well as a little nook on the deck to relax with a meal if desired.
The suite itself is awesome, with lots of cool and enjoyable amenities, such as a fantastic antique-looking gas stove fireplace which was easy to use and perfect for some warmth/to get the chill out when the temperatures dipped low at night and in the early morning. I got a kick out of the heated toilet seat and the toilet light too!
The kitchen was charming, and I admired the shower stall nestled between the bathroom and the laundry room--what a cute design! The bed was fantastic--so comfortable. I slept really well. It was a very quick and easy walk to the hotels/casinos as well as the river walk. I hope to be back!

review_text:
Earle’s place was an adequate place to stay in for the one night I was in town.
Location was great for us as we wanted to be near the Convention Center and airport. The neighborhood wasn’t the best, but the unit was inside facing and quiet. I felt safe, but opted to drive instead of walk around the area.
Check in process was a breeze. There are stairs you need to go down to get to the unit.
Inside, the place was very clean and had plenty space for me and my husband. Shower, toilet and sink were a bit small in size. Overall it was a motel/basement vibe, and not in a bad way.
The internet was knocked out during our stay and our Verizon and ATT phone receptions did not work down there either, which meant we couldn’t use their Roku TV or our phones. They did offer to send someone over right away that evening, but we declined since we were only there for a bit.
There was an AC window unit that was pretty loud when it would click on at night and it didn’t work as hard as my husband would’ve like, so we didn’t sleep well even with me having ear plugs. I would recommend keeping the fan on instead of the ac unit for consistent white noise.
It’s unfortunate, but I think if there wasn’t a heat wave and if we had working internet our stay would’ve been more pleasurable, but those were just the circumstances we were given, and I bet this unit would’ve been a great stay otherwise.
